revised_title: A New Derivative of Tetrodotoxin with Pharmacological Activity
tldr: Researchers have created a new derivative of tetrodotoxin, a powerful sodium channel blocker, by modifying its structure through oxidation. This new derivative retains some of the original compound's pharmacological activity, which could be useful for studying the structure-activity relationship of the toxin and potentially developing new drugs or research tools for studying sodium channels in the nervous system.
